item.title: Initial dev config of cmder and git
item.description: Git A version control, which anybody should be familiar with (at least when one is a developer ;)). The configuration is simple two steps - ssh keys generation, and .gitconfig generating ssh keys Covered in Cmder minimal section .gitconfig Basic config with aliases, additional tools…. [core] editor = \"C:/tools/GitExtensions/GitExtensions.exe\" fileeditor [user] email = ... name = ... [alias] co = checkout ci = commit st = status br = branch [pull] rebase = false [fetch] prune = false [rebase] autoStash = false Cmder… …is one of a nice applications, which bnrings you more closer to linux terminal look-and-feel.

item.title: Wireguard config
item.description: Configuring wireguard is extremely easy. I managed to configure wireguard on my VPS, to connect remote desktop between my workstation and client, everything beneath CGNAT.
